article.headline: Drexel 72, Rider 60
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Dominick Mejia scored 19 points and Bashir Mason had 18 to lead Drexel to a 72-60 victory over Rider on Monday. Frank Elegar and Kenell Sanchez each added 12 points for Drexel (3-0). Lamar Johnson scored 19 points for Rider (0-2) while Jason Thompson scored 16 and Terrance Mouton added 13. The two teams were tied 29-29 at the half, but Drexel went on a 16-2 run after the break, with Mason providing half of the points, to take a 50-38 lead with 9:54 remaining. Mason was 9-of-10 from the free throw line for the game. Rider turned the ball over 24 times and endured a 4:51 scoreless streak. The Broncs cut the lead to six after a Johnson hit a pair of free throws to make the score 54-48 with 5:14 remaining. But Drexel's Dominick Mejia answered with a 3-pointer to extend Drexel's lead to nine, and Rider never got any closer.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
